content: Hello, thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services! How can I help you today?
I need an electrician ASAP. The lights flicker all the time and it's getting worse.
I’m sorry to hear you’re having trouble with your lights. I can help you get booked for an electrical service. Can I please have your name to get started?
Why do you need my name? Can’t you just send someone? This is ridiculous.

I understand it’s frustrating. I ask for your name so our electrician knows who they’re helping and for confirmation when they arrive. This makes your service faster and safer. If you prefer, we can book it under just your first name.
Thank you, Jamie. Can I get the address where you need service, so I can make sure we send someone to the right place?
Every company asks the same stuff. Whatever. It’s 131 Ember St, Apartment 2.
Thanks, Jamie. Let me confirm that’s within our service area before we move forward.
You’re in our service area! What time today or tomorrow works best for our electrician to come by?
The sooner the better, but how much is this gonna cost? I don’t want a surprise bill if it’s some big thing.
I understand—nobody likes surprises! Would you like a price estimate for the flickering lights issue before we schedule?
Yes, give me an estimate, and don’t say you can’t. I want a real number.

I’ll do my best! Our team usually needs to see the issue for an exact price, but most electrical inspections for flickering lights start at $89 for the visit, plus any repair costs. I can ask for a more detailed estimate if you’d like.
So basically I have to pay $89 just to get someone to tell me it costs even more. Typical. Can we do it today or not?
I get your frustration—let’s get this solved. I’ll check our schedule to get you the earliest available time today.
Our electrician can be there today between 1pm and 3pm. Would you like to confirm that slot?
Yeah, just book it. The sooner the better. Don’t flake.
All set! You’re booked for today between 1pm and 3pm at 131 Ember St, Apartment 2. If you have questions or want a reminder before the appointment, just let me know.
